rounds.observation:
[GAME] Welcome to the Poker Arena! You are Player 0 in this high-stakes 2-player Texas Hold'em tournament.
Your mission is to outlast your opponents through strategic betting and skillful play.
Tournament Details:
- 10 hands will be played
- You start with 1000 chips
- Blinds are set at 10/20

Execute your poker strategy using these precise action commands:
  '[Check]'  - pass when no bet is active
  '[Call]'   - match the current betting amount
  '[Fold]'   - surrender your hand
  '[Bet N]'  - initiate betting with N chips
  '[Raise N]'- increase the bet by N chips

Invalid actions will result in retries. Use exact bracket format and ensure you have sufficient chips for bets/raises. Check when facing a bet is invalid.
[GAME] Starting a new 10-round Texas Hold'em game with 2 players.
[GAME] ===== Hand 1 / 10 - Pre‑flop =====
Pot: 30 | Current bet: 20
Visible board: []
P0 (Dealer/BB): 990.00 chips | bet 10.00 | active
P1 (SB): 980.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: Q♣, 2♥
==============================================
rounds.response:
Since I'm Player 0 and the dealer, I've already posted the big blind of 10 chips, and my current bet is considered as 20 chips (including the additional 10 chips to match the total bet of 20). My hole cards are Q♣ and 2♥, which isn't a strong starting hand due to the low kicker and lack of connectivity or suitedness.

Given that I'm already in the pot and my bet is considered as 20 chips, I don't need to take any action to call since my bet is already at the required level. However, my opponent (P1) has already called the big blind by betting 20 chips.

The correct action here is to '[Check]' since the betting is considered complete for this round as both players have matched the big blind.

So, my action is: [Check]

rounds.response:
I’m Player 1 (the small-blind) and I’m first to act post-flop.  
Board is T♠ J♥ 4♠, pot is 40 chips, current bet is 0 and both players have 980 chips.  
My cards are 3♠ 7♠ – a modest back-door flush-draw with only inside-straight possibilities and two under-cards to the board; no pair, no immediate draw.

This board is paired with broadway cards yet fairly dry otherwise. Out of position with a weak holding my best low-risk play is to check and allow Player 0 (in position) to act first so I can see what he does cheaply or fold to aggression if he bets.

[Check]
